Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Pumpkin Waffle

MTBTZ3W1kGo7-Wig1GG3gg.text: Good things first: the food was lovely, sitting outside in the last of the Summer sun was charming and all the servers were friendly.Bad things: the friendly service was a bit so-so. I arrived before friends; told it would be an hour. Popped back with friends to check; seated immediately. Great for lunch, less good for service. Everything else was just a bit slow and haphazard - a friend ordered a savoury muffin and it arrived before our other food and apparently couldn't be heated. All a bit odd.I'll give Caravan another chance, but probably only the one more.

eLnQaLBfSu1DpWNP90kf6g.text: Worst breakfast decision ever! Granola was stale the eggs were meh. The muffin we ordered was too busy doing a "photo shoot". Spent $65 on three of us. Very disappointing!Luckily we went to DISHOOM next door after for their bacon egg naan wrap. It changed our lives!!! Skip Caravan, go to Dishoom (for breakfast and dinner).

Td5CSc2ECD-wgqfgxy4DVQ.text: Good food. Slightly more expensive than your usual brunch for the portion sizes but so delicious!

1hCfnw44LUq4zG--zBvp-A.text: Fabulous, absolutely great place!It's one of the best examples of "third generation coffee-shops", undoubtedly my top-3 favoutirte place to top up with  caffeine.Their biggest advantage-coffee beans are roasted locally, in the back room, hence making amazing smell and filling you up with energy as you enter.Coffee is, well as you expect, outstanding. And another highlight-their bakeries and sandwiches. Try the mozzarella sandwich, exquisite.Crispy Pork belly was a slight disappointment, but who cares. Do go there before at 11:45am, as after 12:00(when they start serving lunch) the queues are getting enormous.

K5w6JRyVFIQdnaAbmD2RuQ.text: What a cool space! It's huge, industrial looking, and somehow cozy at the same time. I'm going to have to do some backtracking here since I'm way behind on reviews, but as my last meal in London, I came here for brunch. I know... :*****(Arrived around 10:30AM and didn't have to wait to be seated (YAY!). To start I had the Watermelon, Apple, Mint juice. I can't say I was a huge fan, it was just alright. Glancing over the menu, I decided upon the Corn fritters and all the other stuff it came with. Since it was missing some meat, I added some chorizo on the side. The chorizo is MONEY because it made this dish complete and utterly delicious.The place was buzzing and filled with Sunday brunchers. The menu isn't too big and don't expect normal breakfast offerings... Caravan puts their own twist on their dishes. I personally like this location more than the Exmouth Market one just because it's bigger and not as cramped. It's just outside King's Cross underground station for easy access as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Cornbread & chorizo

314eENJEJm0rhHuvsOcyUA.text: Caravan's highly praised brunch menu has alluded me so far - so much to my own personal sadness I can't comment on the food. However, this is not for lack of trying.   The waiting list on a weekend morning to get a table here is justification that all the amazing reviews this place gets are on point. If you want to eat brunch here, all I can say is set that alarm clock and make it there early otherwise you'll have quite the wait on your hands.   The coffee - blended and roasted in the cafe/restaurant - is heavenly and I can happily say I'm a little addicted to Caravan's smooth bends. Their baristas really don't miss a trick and deliver the perfect cup each and every time. So even if you can't get yourself a table, don't leave without a coffee!   UPDATE - I've finally eaten here!! We arrived just before doors opened at 10am, the line was right across the square, but we luckily got a spot at the communal table inside. I noticed it began to get quiet around 11/11:30am for a brief period too, so maybe take a risk around that time if you fancy a sleep in.   As for breakfast food - it did not disappoint one bit. I had pumpkin waffles, which were an absolute light and fluffy dream. They also do the classic 'full brekkie' and an amazing looking Kim-chi, which my friend had, then raved about for hours afterwards.

YmNIyk8unv3cVZtqz8Zs6Q.text: Disclaimer - I was only in Caravan briefly, for coffee post lunch at Dishoom. Somehow we came through the wrong door and seated ourselves, possibly skipping a queue (oops...we didn't mean to...). We immediately all commented on how much we liked the space - high ceilings, loads of light, attractive settings, all very promising. It was also notably pretty full, which at 3.30pm seemed quite impressive. I only had a coffee, so there's not loads to go on, but I was pretty disappointed - it was bitter, perhaps even burnt, so that rather took away from the experience. My friend's hot chocolate was apparently fine, but quite small for the price tag. My boyfriend ordered a dessert that turned out to be pretty much a scoop of mascarpone with cherries. Not terrible, but kind of odd and artless. If I go again, I'll update, as the menu did look enticing so the food might be worth a try.

azF-iiiDOt0MbUuIEkYiAA.text: A great location in Camden town. Came here with a friend from my hostel nearby(was visiting from NYC). Love Grenery park, it's so nice. We sat inside, didn't need reservations which was good. The place is HUGE, and looks a bit like  a biergarten. The back has an industrial feel to it, where the bathrooms are. The food was good, but not something amazing. The coffee also, pretty okay. Overall, not sure why my friend recommended this place so much--it was pretty ordinary.

pVgjRW1BYobQqLIOGHoi6A.text: Loved their brunch menu! Very much on the high end of 4 stars.Atmosphere:Exact sort of decor I love and one that fits a template. High ceilings, modern clean looking wooden tables and quite a bit of wood generally. Steel ish chairs with grey cushions. Slightly industrial look furthered by the existence of some exposed piping on the ceiling and brick walls (at least the entrance wall). And of course obligatory random vintage furnishings, in this case candlesticks in cool holders being the main thing.Queue:They don't take reservations for brunch and apparently the wait gets ridiculous. With this in mind we went at 1105 on a Saturday. We were seated immediately but it looked like we might have gotten lucky because it was already full and a queue started to form pretty much right after us. It was packed when we left at 1230 but if I had to guess, I'd say that as long as you get there by around 1130, the wait should be manageable.Food/drinks:Had the banana and vanilla smoothie which I loved. Unfortunately I drank it way too fast and at £4.5 it felt a bit much to get another. Would have loved a slightly bigger glass but can't really complain.Beyond that, 3 of us shared everything we ordered. Namely:Raclette French toast with bacon and watercress - The French toast is essentially stuffed with cheese and topped with bacon. The cheese was served melting hot; gooey and delicious. Loved it but very much a 'thank god we shared' dish because it's just a bit too heavy and too cheesey.Aubergine puree with poached eggs and sourdough - As described really. Tasty dish. Their bread is particularly good.Berry waffles with mascarpone - not sure if this was crispy at the time it was served because we ate it last. Fortunately it was smothered in sauce so it wasn't that awkward kind of soggy but the whole hearted drenched in sauce awesome kind of soggy. Another great dish. Possibly a bit too sweet. Was really glad we effectively had it as dessert because it just doesn't really feel like a main.Bitter chocolate tart - Another good to share dish. It was a lovely tart but extremely dense. Wouldn't want to have a whole.Notes:Unisex toilets which is always a bit weird. They had exfoliating Aesop hand wash though so that was cool.Overall:Basically, pretty damn good.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Granary Square (Caravan is by the bottom left of the pic)
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Bitter chocolate tart
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Berry waffles with mascarpone

BXFBiM9e9IBL3gzUNW8f8Q.text: Their baked eggs are amazing; full of different flavours without any one of them overpowering the others. The wild boar sausages I had as aside were quite sweet though so I'll probably skip them next time.  Apart from one person who seemed to think it was an effort to show us to the table, all the staff are lovely and very friendly.I'll definitely be back though as the food overall is very tasty and very filling without leaving you bloated.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Baked eggs with chorizo. Tasty.

1Tbo73b4UbsM97f4asdRBw.text: I've wanted to come here for AGES but there's always such a big queue at the weekends, so recently when I wasn't working during the day time mid week I made the most of the opportunity and headed to Caravan and got seated straight away. What an amazing building inside, lots of space and with seating outside too they must make an absolute killing at the weekend! It's really airy inside and definitely somewhere that you can relax and have a leisurely breakfast/lunch. I was greeted by a very smiley/friendly waitress and I ordered a Flat White straight away whilst I perused the menu. I'd heard amazing things about the coffee here so was really excited to try it! It arrived quickly but was luke warm and not as impressive as I thought it was going to be, shame.I then frustratingly waited around 25 minutes to order my breakfast whilst I watched the waitress serving everyone that had come in after me, frantically trying to get her attention. In the end I had to get up and go over and tell her that I was waiting to order. To be fair she looked horrified and said that she thought I had already ordered food....that was a bit frustrating as if she'd checked in to see if everything was ok then the problem would have been resolved a lot sooner. Anyway, that aside the food was incredible! I ordered the poached egg and avocado on toast which was HUGE and scrumptious. I also ordered a spicy wheatgrass juice shot with chili and coriander in which was AMAZING! I'll definitely be getting that when I return. And I will return very soon, forget the hiccup with the service this place rocks!

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Flat White
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Menu

cxiWpstrsjMlPRJm0u4SBQ.text: I thought this place was alright...but it wasn't so good that I'll be rushing back (this might be good news for other yelpers, as everyone else seems to love it!)The good parts:- I like their style - it's good to bring a little of East-London-style-warehouse-ness to Kings cross.- The brunch menu sounds amazing! I wanted to order EVERYTHING!- My brunch was really tasty - I tried the courgette and sweetcorn fritters- I like that they take your number and call you when you're table is ready. It meant we could chill in the sun by the canal and chat, instead of standing in a queue like the breakfast club. The less good:- Expect a wait...We arrived at 11:30 on a Saturday, and waited 45mins for a table...and then waited another 45mins for food. Service is slooooooow.- Staff were friendly, but it was hard to flag them down as they were so busy. I'm not sure how they managed to be so busy, and so slow at the same time. - Although the food tasted good, it was all cold. My friends waffle had absolutely no warmth...and mine was luke-warm. That was pretty disappointing after waiting for 1.5 hours!!I don't think I'd come back unless it was really early when maybe we'd have a chance of hot food.p.s. I just edited this three times because I can't decide between 2 or 3 stars...but I setted on two because I don't like paying £20 for cold cooked brunch, even if it is tasty.

EKdeNwjf-JdEgLfIKNPbxA.text: I so love caravan! I have been coming here on and off for a few years and every time it is fantastic. Let's start with the coffee - which is amazing. One of the best flat whites in london- a 9 out of 10. For 2 I like at least 6 sharing plates. The burrata was a recent highlight as were the croquettes. Can't wait for southbank to open closer to home

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom

LNUjciXuFFd4yZuSTj5kTg.text: Solid restaurant to go to in London. Great espresso martinis. Their pizza and oxtail was a delicious combo to appease our small appetite for the night.

ISCcBFvZ-losS6pxZmDIAQ.text: Residing in the rapidly developing Kings Cross area, Caravan is a great restaurant which emulates an industrial vibe without being impersonal. The wait on a Saturday is 45 minutes, however with that said, they set you up in a bar area that accommodates for all of us hungry waiting diners. I ordered the aubergine purée with yoghurt and grilled flatbread. It was a wonderful dish which managed to introduce interesting and unique flavours. I also felt extremely satisfied after, and must say that if you want value for money in this city, this is a must go! My friends, who had the baked eggs and jalapeño cornbread respectively, were also satisfied with the flavours and portion sizes. For those wanting a boozy brunch, Caravan also offers a nice selection of cocktails. A refreshing variety for brunch, combined with the airy and communal vibe, made my experience here a great one.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. A nice friendly atmosphere
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Aubergine puree with boiled eggs and yoghurt in all its glory. Check out the size of that flatbread!

a4iFVvYdKTgk7qNzQSdTwg.text: I was looking for a place for Brunch and a nice place to meet up with my friend in London and i found online this place, its located in a new area behind Kings Cross Station at Granary Square. Its about a 5 minute walk away from Kings Cross or St Pancras so its perfect before waiting for a train. Caravan Kings cross is in a converted Granary Building and the whole place was buzzing when i arrived. I wanted to sit outside and they said it would be a 20-25 minute wait as it was extremely busy, this was at 11am so he said for me to grab a coffee at the bar whilst i waited for the table and they also gave me a bag of coffee with a number on it and when the table was ready they would come and get us. So i waited around the bar and ordered my coffee and minutes later the table was ready. Great. So the nice lady took us to the table and asked us what drinks we wanted but we was already waiting for the coffees we ordered at the bar. Seconds later the coffees arrived with a big jug of water. My latte tasted amazing! A few minutes later the nice lady came to ask us what we would like for breakfast, i had poached eggs on Sour dough and it was delicious.i totally recommend this place to either sit inside or out, the whole place was really buzzing and had a great atmosphere to the place and the staff were really friendly.I cant wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom

c8gOLz1QTcdOncYwiJCBpw.text: Love the ambience of this place. Wish I could have fit more breakfast in but just settled with a coffee instead. Coffee was pretty good. They made lovely coffee art and the milk was heated to perfection!

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom

A-e3wHWiiqG9y2vH9pxvhg.text: En I like the decoration but I probably won't go back for food again. The avocado on toast is kind of too sour and the bread is way too hard to be cut even though I ordered the softer one. As for the baked egg, not bad and not good. Oh I like the coffee/ latte.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom

OeYhlvQ_z_v608A-xa4Fhg.text: After a light brunch, we came here to get our coffee and cake fix. Although the place was not full, we were no allowed to seat in the main restaurant as we were not dining. Luckily, there was space on the large communal table at the back, behind the coffee bar. We were impressed by the space and quality of coffees. Unfortunately they had a power failure the night before we visited so for those of us who ordered tea, the milk that came with it was questionable. After going up to the bar twice, we managed to get some safer looking milk. The cakes and pastries got thumbs up all around, but a theme for Kings Cross (or the whole London in general it seems) is that you will not be getting value for money - a small portion (2-3 bites-full) of cake for £2.50!From reading the other reviews on here, I think I'd get a better experience from dining so I'll be sure to re-visit and re-review!

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Cakes!
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Rhubarb frangipan Danish

9zFzb4wZ-pcrO3rTJFr8rw.text: Let's face it, food in England is not that great. So when you find a good restaurant in London, you stick to it! And this one will not disappoint you. The food there is absolutely amazing. The best thing to do while at Caravan is to order all kinds of small plates and share them tapas style. The recipes are very creative as they blend all kinds of flavors from all over the world. Not your typical recipes but you will learn about all kinds of off the wall weird ingredients. This experience taught me a lot about food I had never heard of before. And every time I go back, the menu is different but as good as the previous time. Although small, the cocktails are very creative and oh so delish! And the deserts are out of this world. The restaurant's building is an old factory that was renovated into a trendy type setting. The negative part is that it is always loud so don't go there if you are hoping for a quiet meal. Service is generally good and the food comes out pretty fast. This restaurant is conveniently located near the King's Cross tube station and the cost is relatively good for the city. Oh and one more thing, make sure you go wash your hands in the restrooms. The Aēsop exfoliating hand soap and lotion will renew your hands and leave a scent that will delight your senses for hours to come! Enjoy!

bK8g0R9u9Vsm5qBBK4bDiw.text: I had bookmarked this restaurant during my quest of the best avocado toast in London. I arrived too late for breakfast but thought I'll still try it. Menu is pretty extensive: small plates, starters, main, sides... There's a size for every stomach. I was pretty hungry and there was so many good things on the menu that I went for 2 small plates and 1 side. Spoiler alert: the plates are not small. I took the ham and cheese croquettas and the burrata with tomato relish with a side of corn bread (with real corn inside it, topped with melting better) and it was absolutely delicious.Service was fantastic: I had a train to catch and only had 45min to eat and they brought my plates in less than 5minutes. They were also super friendly and nice (they even did my coffee to take away so I could enjoy in the train)The place is a bit loud, especially at lunch time but it's mainly people talking about how good the food is.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. "Small" plates. I recommend to take only 2 for lunch.

ruhtb-Toe963_O7_PVDSaA.text: Will have to go back to try the full menu but as far as it stands, yes I am a fan. Beautiful space, very popular, mixing a restaurant, a bar, and a coffee place all under one big roof. You can see everything at once, so that is why it is and looks crowded. We sat at the bar at the back and ordered drinks and plates to share. Everything was great from the octopus, to the burratta, not forgetting the artichoke salad, camember etc. Perfect. Nice staff, eclectic customer crowd, steps from King's Cross. This place is in a semi industrial building, next to the canal which gives you the possibility to get a nice walk after lunch/dinner.Will have to go back to try breakfast, lunch and dinner by ordering the full plates. Really recommend it.

mFS19faf21eYRNZO52O9Vg.text: I came here for breakfast before work one morning and had a yummy quinoa and buckwheat grain bowl, with sweet potato, broccoli, peanuts and a nice tahini-miso dressing (optional soft boiled egg for non-vegans). It was a huuuuuge portion, with a mountain of quinoa, I was too full to eat lunch with my colleagues later =p Very tasty!My boyfriend had a traditional brunchy dish, but got a very disappointing amount of sausage despite paying £2 extra to have it. Prices were fairly high, but kind of in the range expected for the location. I like the kinda hipster, distressed furniture, decor they have going. Great place for brunch =]

eH8c1Tjuzpn37QnVHn6v1w.text: Oh, you know...it's a pretty sweet spot. Converted warehouse building with soaring ceilings, rustic wood interior, fine coffee and cakes, and a full menu by which to indulge. This sweet spot can, however, be hard to find. Please do not make the mistake I have made (multiple times). If you are coming out of Kings Cross Station it's quite easy, exit out the back (north) and there is a pathway that will run you directly into "Granary Square" where you'll see the UAL, Kings Cross Museum, etc -- nestled in this refurbished complex is Caravan, though the signs are not very loud. Also, I told my cab driver this morning "Granary Square in N1" -- which will end you in a weird residential block off Liverpool Road. The postcode here is N1C, my bad. Regardless...I finally made it, but do map the directions before endeavoring as its quite "hidden" by London standards. My taxi driver was baffled! I've eaten here on more than one occasion, dinner and breakfasts. It's a preferred breakfast spot as its quite centrally located (once you find it) to Kings Cross, and quite large to accommodate groups. This morning I enjoyed the jalapeno cornbread with fried egg and beans (the beans were woefully undercooked, if cooked at all?), plus a side of avocado, which was very nice and added quite a bit to the dish. It's an extra £4 for that avocado though, sooooo about half the price of my entire dish. Seems, pricey. However, good. If dining in -- make a reservation. They do take away orders as well...plus a smaller coffee bar/shop with cakes and a few tables in the back near the roastery. If interested, order the coconut bread, rhubarb cake dish. I really wanted to, please tell me how it is! I will return for it. COCONUT BREAD? How did I not order it? I don't know. So, once you make it -- I think you'll quite like it. The service is always a bit standoffish, but fine enough...apparently that doesn't stop anyone from coming, as its always bustling and full of life.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom

XG9zbMt4zvMEhI9OxUmv0g.text: Boy this place really put a smile on my face! :DIf I tell you it's a cavernous, converted Victorian grain store accessible by a concrete walkway out the back of Kings Cross station that makes you think you're in the middle of industrial no-mans-land - then I'd wager that words like 'cosy' and 'buzzing' aren't the first ones on your mind! In fact Caravan manages to be all of these things and more.I went for dinner in a group of 4, and good job we booked in advance as the place was rammo. It still has that 'we're all friends here' vibe though, helped by the fact that they have a lot of long communal tables, and a really mixed crowd - great for people-watching yay :)The menu is unexpectedly interesting (more on this in a minute), and great for veggies (all 3 of my companions) and meat-eaters alike. We ordered a mix of small and large plates to share (always the best way) and got stuck in. Highlights included the jalapeno corn bread with chipotle butter and the blue cheese dish with figs and orange honey - see what I mean about interesting?! Slightly usual combinations that turned out oh so tasty. Ooh the butternut squash and pesto pizza was also yum, and I can't go without recommending a) you get dessert and b) try a cocktail - mine involved gin and blackberry jam and managed to erase its own name from my memory...try it though!The thus far unsung hero of the evening (and the main reason that bumped this up to 5-stars) was our server - a cute five-foot-something goateed hipster-spec-ed guy who was just so goddamn charmingly cool (or coolly charming?!) that you wanted to just keep on ordering stuff. Hmm well played, Caravan.Yes it's predictable in fulfilling that now well-known London equation: obscure industrial space + restaurant makeover = *hipster alert*, but it keeps a good amount of heart alongside that. I'll be back for sure (and hope for the same server..!).

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. gin & blackberry jam cocktail

K3sYqvrl2AFxsCIsVBOx5A.text: Don't skip dessert!  We had the pavlova and something chocolate and both were spectacular.  I'm not really a dessert person and would have begged off as too full, so I'm *so* glad I was there with dessert people!The rest of the meal was also great, I think the small plates (we had pork belly, softshelled crabbed, little gem lettuces, smoked trout and the burrata - i'd skip the burrata next time, sort of boring) were slightly better than the pizzas (we had the anchovy pizza and the boar sausage pizza) but the pizzas helped add substance on the slightly-cheaper, we didn't try any of the large plates.Atmosphere was dark, busy and loud in a festive but not overwhelming way.  Definitely make a reservation for dinner (I haven't been for brunch) -- it was almost filled up a week out for 7:15 on a wednesday, very popular.

hXUygf2J3desrACjBaQqtA.text: Excellent food, excellent location, even better drinks (both coffee and alcohol). I sat at the communal table in the back both times due to the wait times and me being a solo traveler and have mixed reviews on that. First time was cramped but enjoyable. Second time they sat a group of four, two of which were some very... rambunctious (read: badly behaving) children. Didn't make sense to me why they would seat them right next to me when the entire table was open and they could've been seated at the other end but, hey. I don't run the place, I just love the food. Definitely recommend any of the toasts (avocado SO good) and getting a mimosa with the fresh grapefruit juice instead of OJ. If you're a fan of brunch and are in the area, look no further!

JakygloxALbvC0tPQwp5Bw.text: They don't take brunch reservations but it's usually not a long wait and you can sit at the bar, sip a coffee, and chat with the charming baristas in the meantime. The atmosphere is the coolest thing about the place anyway. They transformed the old granary in a stylish fashion and it's a pleasure to just take in the space. Caravan is famous for their speciality coffee so I ordered a long black but it wasn't really to my taste - too sour and lemony for me. Even in the soy cap I had later on, that strong aroma still kinda bothered me. But I'm not questioning the quality of the coffee!I shared the avocado on sourdough and the quinoa dish with my friend. The latter was spiced interestingly and I didn't dislike it but it also wasn't particularly amazing as a dish.I still feel like I'd come back for the food and above all for the ambience.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Quinoa with broccoli and heritage carrots sharing the plate with half of an avocado on sourdough

WI-MLXODkBr2MOYkY8X6Bw.text: Coffee gets the two thumbs up. Decor and setting does too. And the cakes and breads look pretty darn delicious. You will get the disclaimer if you would like to sit outside that you will not be moved inside if it starts raining (no matter the amount of empty tables are inside). But if you can, sit outside and enjoy the people watch. It is a bit of a windy spot so fingers crossed you don't get a crowd of smokers outside the eating area blowing ash on you.The food is ok. It is a little on the pricey side for what they are putting out. Breakfast finishes at 11:30 mid week then it is a pizza or small plates menu. I don't love the menu but there are some good things on offer but they're not quite there. And if you are ordering a couple of the small dishes to share (recommended) then you need to consider which flavours will go together because I don't think they all go. Wine list by the glass especially for whites (and there is about 7) needs a review. They are all in a similar flavour spectrum: lighter, acidic, non oaked, probably a touch mineral or herbacious. Would love to see one aged white or a fuller bodied something. If I come here again it will be for a bottle of wine (not glass) with selections from the cheese and meats menu. Goats cheese and nuts and honey was amazing. You will need to order bread to go with it and pay extra though.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Fried with poached
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Baked eggs with sausage
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Baked eggs

oTrH9tNrWJ405CbsQzjgkA.text: My friend and I treated ourselves to brunch here last weekend and again we were so impressed with the food and service.We arrived at 10.45 without booking (not sure if you can book?) and new we would be up for a wait. They took our number and we ordered a coffee to go and sat outside in their outdoors seating and chatted/ played cards til they called us (we were in no rush) but just be warned on the weekends you're going to have to wait to get a table!While we waited we looked at the menu so we knew exactly what we were going to get when we sat down! Exactly 45 minutes later they rang us so we dashed inside and were seated right away!As there was so much on the menu to try we decided to share everything and get one dish at a time. To start we ordered the kimchee pork belly pancake which was sooo good! Pork was delicious and full of flavours. Pancake isn't so pancakey but tasty all the same. I couldn't have eaten the whole thing though! We also ordered the apricot mimosas which were good but nothing amazing! Next up was the pumpkin waffle with ricotta, peppers, pecans and maple syrup. I thought this dish was going to more of a sweet dish but it was actually savoury! Interesting flavours and worth trying but again couldn't eat the whole thing. Finally we had the coconut bread with lemon curd and strawberries! My favourite by far! Would definitely have again to myself! Overall had a lovely brunch - the waitress was very friendly and we weren't rushed at all! Will definitely be back for brunch but looking to try the bbq beans and the baked eggs next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Kimchi pancake with pork belly and fried egg
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Pumpkin waffle
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Coconut bread

YGfj-6JJQpoQE9yBC2qBTw.text: For a fun night out with great food and an interesting location, check out Caravan. Make sure you get there before you're ready to eat because there's a good chance you'll have a wait! We rolled up around 8 and didn't get a table until 9. Having put our names down, we grabbed out number -- a bag of coffee beans! -- and headed to the bar. There's a great selection of spirits and beers. Drink in hand, it's off to sit and wait. The outside waiting area has a lot of seats with tables, benches around the edge -- plenty of room to hang out and catch up with friends I haven't seen in almost 2 years.  Eventually we got called inside to our table. It's loud but not deafening, lit well enough to actually read the menu, and filled with ecclectic character. And then we got a look at the menu. OMG, talk about drool-worthy! With a bit of discussion we decided to go with a selection of small plates...and some potato bread. Washed down with a tasty bottle of red. Everything was beautifully presented, still hot, and filled with flavour. We had room for dessert -- some panna cotta, ice cream... and a cheese platter with yummy quince jam! And a bottle of sauterne to enhance it all.There was nothing to complain about -- service was friendly and good, the food was incredible, and the atmosphere fun. Definitely a place to return to next time I'm in London

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Chateau Partarrieu Sauterne -- a great little dessert wine with apricot notes. It complements a cheese and quince jam platter beautifully!
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Jamon & smoked San Simon croquettes and saffron mayonnaise. The San Simon cheese is glorious and totally makes these divine.
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Lamb meatballs with chermoula, aubergine, tahini, & pickled red onion. A bit salty but very tasty with the tahini

mXyV-OH2Q3VfkLGiYX1Bsg.text: This is a stunning coffee shop. It has brilliant coffee from around the world and excellent, friendly staff. It's a great place to work as there is a buzz of activity without it becoming too noisy. There are also floor based power sockets which are a working essential.If this place were a film I would say it was The Italian Job as the coffee here will blow your doors off.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom

08SgFnLXTcHjFsn8PAynzQ.text: Brunch here was fire . And the wait staff were perfection - particularly the tall, African American ex-model with the vibrant personality and sense of humor. She made the meal so much better with her recommendations and stories to share. We came here for brunch on a Sunday I believe and it was so lovely. The queue was shorter than anticipated and we went through the line quickly. If you don't want to wait in line, you can always book ahead as well. We started with drinks of course - might I suggest the blueberry & tarragon shrub, as well as the morning G&T. Don't order the Bloody Mary however, as it's pre-mixed the night before to save time, which doesn't really make for the best morning cocktail. For our mains, we ordered the crushed potato mung Dahl and the fried cornbread. Both were marvelous and I LOVED the side of pork & leek sausage. This restaurant is not meant for you to come in and order avocado toast. Be adventurous and try something special that Caravan has created. Looking forward to trying dinner here in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Blueberry shrub YUM
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Mung Dahl - order it for brunch, you won't be disappointed!

PHB-GnhUn0GRdFxr3wUi0Q.text: If you're looking for a quiet place to eat, this isn't it.  It's absolutely buzzing with music and conversation and activity.  But the food, which I imagine you're most interested in, is really the highlight.  A delicious list of choices for breakfast, without being overwhelming.  Service is fast and the prices are not cheap, but are fairly reasonable nevertheless.

ACO-AUGZmt0nIHGdNEO_sQ.text: Add one of the Caravan locations to your breakfast/brunch plans. We made reservations, but it wasn't too busy when we were in. The menu is creative and everything we tried was done really well!This may be weird to say, but I just started eating avocados in the last year or two. But they're in every dish -- all over the world. It became the new salt so...I finally gave in. And... they're not so bad. I had the best guacamole here :) It came with the fried eggs over jalapeno cornbread and black beans. This was an awesome dish and a combination I had not had before. Note: Smoked salmon on menus in London are different than we think it is in the Pacific Northwest. Smoked salmon here is brined (raw) like lox, while at home, it's cooked via smoking. I like both preparations equally, but with just-cooked scrambled eggs like at Caravan's? The raw version is the perfect complement. Drip coffee is served in beaker, pretty cute but drink it fast before it cools off ;) And try one of the juices! I recommend the carrot apple ginger with tamarind.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Drip coffee
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom

O2uYGFE4ruyrU0dtDmtwAg.text: We had a reservation (there was a long queue outside so I would definitely recommend a prior reservation). Waiters are super friendly and efficient despite it being a very busy Wednesday evening.I had the pan friend mackerel, jersey royals and garam masala mayonnaise. This was delicious! But be warned - the portion is TINY (more like what you would expect from a starter). My friend had the crispy chilli salt tofu - again just one chunk of tofu. So if you're going with a good appetite, you will definitely need more than one main dish (or get a starter, main and dessert). For the pudding we had the coconut panna cotta. I'm not a huge fan of panna cotta to start with, but after a few bites of this I stopped. The vanilla ice cream with the espresso caramel sauce was delicious! Would recommend. Overall:Food is yummy and the restaurant has a great vibe, but be aware that the portions are small - I overhead people on tables next to us commenting on this as well so it's not just me!Service - fantastic.

_qWfmf7IPEgqnmpJtX0mZw.text: If there's one thing I dislike about Caravan, it's that their brunch menu gave me a difficult time ordering. Sigh. I suppose that works as a positive too, since everything sounded delicious.One interesting thing I noted was that upon queueing, they handed me a coffee bag with a number written on it. I was so confused, but apparently that's how they kept track of my position in line. How funny! Now there's something you don't see everyday - especially in King's Cross.// Jalapeño corn bread, fried eggs, black beans, guindilla pepper (£9.50) - 4 stars// Kimchi pancake, pork belly, fried duck egg, bbq crème fraiche (£12) - 4 starsP.S. Unisex toilets? That's kinda weird.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Jalapeno corn bread, fried eggs, black beans, guindilla pepper (9.50)
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Kimchi pancake, pork belly, fried duck egg, bbq creme fraiche (12)
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Flat White (2.80)

TNT65bxSatkicebEkNmSTg.text: Excellent fancy coffee. The menu is a bit intimidating (combinations of what coffee and how you want it made are tough when your objective is "coffee, pretty good"). There is seating, presumably more for if you're grabbing a bite, with bar seating if you're solo or just having a cup of coffee.I would love to see a simple coffee option (ex. "of the day" or "house pour") to make it a bit simpler. Pleasant interior and nice staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom

J4itAr7Lvip3O1EdA_C7Zg.text: Amazing place for a good and fulfill brunch!The only bad point : you can't make reservation. With my friends we waited around 40 minutes to get a table. During this time we ordered some nice hot drinks.Once seated we ordered different things : cumin waffles, coconut bread with lemon curd, avocado toast, muffin of the day ( with gojie berries and apricots) and an English breakfast. Everything was delicious.The atmosphere is really nice and casual, the staff is nice. We had a real good time there

KvDe10ngwTGv_EL8vr2nvg.text: If only the weather wasn't this gloomy today, it would have been the perfect lunch break #boo. Lovely location with nice quiet scenery, would have been great if the sun was out though. Service was quick and the staff was polite. They did tell us in advance that it may rain, and we may have a problem getting seats inside (it was lunch hour), he gave us a choice to move in but we decided to sit outside anyway. What we ordered:1. Potato bread, lemon thyme butter £3.502. Grilled asparagus, preserved lemon mayo, soft egg, hazelnut dukkah £9 (recommended)3. Burmese chicken salad, turmeric, chili, lime, peanuts £7.504. Crispy Pork belly, cider miso caramel, apple walnut slaw £9 (highly recommended)5. Boar sausage, confit cherry tomato, grilled radicchio, taleggio pizza £126. Chorizo and sweet potato croquettes, saffron oil £67. Jalapeño corn bread, chipotle butter (spicy) - £4I'd skip the pizza and the Burmese chicken salad, wasn't my favorite. However the pork is super! It comes in a small plate (to share) but I'd probably just keep it to myself. The croquette and jalapeño bread was interesting though. I liked the grilled asparagus, again I wouldn't share it with anyone if I were you.Good portion here (other than the pizza) is small - whatever we ordered were starters and small plate sizes to share, it would enough for two, maybe not three.Our bill came up to £66 including drinks for 3pax. I'd say it's reasonable. Nice place to hang and read a book or just chill.

vQMxM_mzba3fRLu0iruLQA.text: We came here for breakfast and were super happy with the quality of the coffee as well as the food. Its a casual environment but still feels hip.  I suspect we would have needed  a reservation for anything except mid-week breakfast - it was quite popular.  All the egg dishes are fantastic - and the roasted tomatoes are particularly flavorful.The have free wifi (just ask for the password).   A little bit pricey for what it is, but after a long-haul flight I was thrilled with the quality and comfortable environment.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Fried eggs on sourdough with a side of tomatoes

dAmfc4-eAs8iJm1fNndYkg.text: Caused a bit of a contretemps this review....my wife was all about 4/5 stars....but this is my review and it gets 3 for the following reasons.Good:Superb Dining room, everything a casual 2016 London experience should be...Atmosphere to match (even on a weekday lunchtime) Interesting and varied menu, something for vegans to meat eaters alikeNot so good:Service, whilst friendly, was woeful in terms of getting the orders right....several dishes arrived and had to be sent back as not what we orderedPuddings, subjectively I thought a pretty poor offering and not great, tried most of them as ate with a group and just 'meh'Pizza's....not the best...chewy, sloppy and in my opinion not that tasty.Go for the atmosphere and dining space, not for the culinary experience

8JJ8OvU3kQRR7av3-zrhsg.text: Awesome bartender awesome food. Try all of the cocktails--the bartenders make them with such care and they are all delicious. If you like cumin you will love the margs!Gets very busy but my friend and I were able to snag two seats at the bar and watch the bartender at work so it perfect. Also right across the street from the king's cross theater!

_wibFlU_xXEL4LeGNehrrQ.text: Service was mediocre. Food was not amazing for what you pay. Would rather have eaten anywhere but there.Duck confit was overly dry that you couldn't even taste the duck flavor and it was tough.Pork ribeye was tough and not seasoned well. Pickle garnish was a waste, too sour and unnecessary. Best part of the meal was my espresso but even that was subpar.

PVmLFVDctCXzzojmzVhObw.text: Although the wait was long when we came in for Sunday brunch, we stopped at the nearby grocery store and bought a few things, and our table was ready by the time we returned. Once we were seated, service was quick and pleasant. The environment was very busy, but it wasn't too loud to have a good conversation! I had the jalapeño cornbread avocado toast, which was absolutely delicious, as well as a pot of rooibos tea. The toast came with two sunny side up eggs, and was more than enough for me! My friend got the coconut pancake and also though it was tasty. We both paid 16 pounds, which was on the pricey end for a non-alcoholic brunch, but definitely a yummy treat!One star deducted because I think our server forgot about us, and we waited 30 minutes for the check

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom

CC6_ngbqMrTRPzPU6pIyaQ.text: We ate here twice during our last visit, and both meals were delightful! The staff on both occasions were super on point, and despite the large crowds we were seated and fed with a quickness. Our first visit was for breakfast during the week, and we shared some scones, poached eggs, and some kind of heavenly lemon coconut bread + coffee drinks. We had to pack up some of it for takeaway (granted we don't typically eat large portions... but rather we snack all day like peckish foxes). The second visit was near the end of a weekend brunch service on a terribly hot day. Despite the heat and it being near closing our server was funny, sweet, and helpful, and the food service was just as quick. My better half had the sweet porridge, I had a grain bowl, and our friend had a crawfish salad (I think?), plus juices. Another great meal! We will definitely be back when we pop over again.

FajfUKAfcQOIymyiX4eBDQ.text: Really chilled and hipster atmosphere in a stylish warehouse space - take your date to impress with trendy London ;) Food was good, but beware of some very small portions for the "small plates". Best to treat them like tapas, but that'll hit your wallet very quick! Went for my last Brunch in London with Matt

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Jamon Croquettes (amazing!) and Salmon
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom

ZZTD3oQS8wkzqIiDb4cr6A.text: This has been our first meal in London that used spicy pepper for flavors! I'm sure others do too but the service was friendly and the food was great. The braised Oxtail was so yummy and the blue cheese filled wontons was amazing . If you are staying near King Cross Station this place is a must !

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Yummy cocktail

Wzy1IeRkYmNDadmxwh5HmA.text: Yes, yes, yes, yes, YES... Was my first thought when we arrived bright and early this Saturday morning! Caravan has been on my brunch hit list for so long now and I finally discovered the answer of being able to get a table - get your arse out of bed on a Saturday! We arrived and were third in the queue, the queue that by opening time ten minutes later was around the block! The doors opened and we were kindly shown to our table! (The third table to be seated - YEY). We were soon greeted by a friendly American waitress who offered up some water. We were waiting for a friend so this was a very casual affair (she was 45 minutes late) but the waitress never batted an eye lid and allowed us to order at out leisure despite the place obviously becoming rammed! First we ordered a fruit scone and a round of toast and jam for starters (brunch starters are now a thing). They arrived quickly. The toast was thick slices of grain bread (as requested) with a pot of butter, fresh raspberry jam and marmalade! The raspberry jam was to die for and complimented the grain toast and butter deliciously! Who knew toast could taste this good. The scone then arrived and WOW what a scone - it was huge! We thought it was burned at first but, of course, it wasn't! It was freshly baked, and beautifully soft and buttery in the middle! We slapped on that jam and tucked in with traditional English flair!And now to the main event! I hadn't had avocado for a while and I couldn't wait to try pretty much everything on the menu that went on it or with it so I had the avocado with chilli on toast with a poached egg and sides of streaky bacon and mushrooms. NOM.One thing I must point out at this stage is Caravan know what their doing, their food comes out fast and fresh and the door is ever revolving with new customers when and where possible. It's an art and they nail it.Our mass order arrived quickly and my oh my was it worth the wait. Another slice of grain toast stacked high with delicious fresh and chunky avocado and chilli flakes - an avodream! The poached egg was cooked to perfection and when you combined it with the crispy salty streaky bacon and mushrooms I hate a brunch fit for a queen! I won't lie, I ate every mouthful and I'm not ashamed! It was just wonderful and everyone else agreed! The coffees are also made and served fresh and are apparently fantastic!Go there, get out of bed on a Saturday morning and go! It's worth your alarm going off, trust me!

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. My whopper main brunch meal
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. Alex's beautifully presented coffee!
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. The Scone!

wXjCn3XCj3JC7yicMU9IEA.text: Amazing food.  I didn't expect Indian food to be this great. The lamb chops were delicious.

GxXBO5_x9ebbIzjFQ_bxYw.text: This was our third visit to this branch of Caravan and the experience was very similar each time. Be prepared to queue for two reasons. Firstly, this place is popular, particularly at weekend lunchtimes. Secondly, they struggle to match diners to tables, so you often have people waiting at the bar and by the door while there are loads of empty tables and no sign of customers with bookings to take them.The best thing about Caravan - both in King's Cross and Exmouth Market - is the food. In my experience they get it right every time. The small plates and side dishes are delicious. I shared the avocado on sourdough, which I love (all of their toast dishes are great) and had the breaded salt beef dish with poached eggs, spinach and hollandaise. This dish is outstanding and is the star of the King's Cross branch. It is well-prepared and well seasoned, filling without being too heavy and the hollandaise is just the right balance of tangy, buttery and rich.We were (eventually) seated near the kitchen and it was great to see it in action. It is really efficient and our order was delivered in lightning speed once we had placed it. If only the rest of the place were so well organised.What lets the place down is its noticeable inefficiency, particularly when it comes to the bar. The first time we came here, we ordered drinks while waiting at the bar and they were delivered 45 minutes later at the table after we had finished eating and only after we had reminded them about 5 times. This time around, we ordered drinks at the bar - a bloody mary and a fresh lemonade. The guy who took our order typed it into the computer and then proceeded to unload the dishwasher. Another two barman came to try to take our order in the next few minutes, but nobody seemed to actually be making the drinks (the bloody mary was prepared on the other side of the bar, but the ratio of people making drinks to taking orders seems to be wrong). The bloody mary was delivered 10 minutes later (nice by the way) and at that point, the barman in front of us started assembling the lemonade.When we finished eating, we ordered coffee to go. This also took a long time to arrive and when it did, they didn't bring the bill, which we then had to ask for twice (I'm not sure why they didn't make the connection between the coffee to go and bringing us the bill). As we paid and got ready to leave, the couple beside us, who had paid their bill at the time we placed our coffee order, reminded the waitress that they too had ordered coffee to go. So lots of customers are sitting around waiting to leave while a huge queue of people are sitting and standing around waiting for tables.In short, if this place could be a bit better organised, it would be outstanding (it would probably also be able to accommodate a lot more customers). It is definitely worth the visit to sample the excellent food, but make sure you have the time to spend.

Z_1sX3NFaLnYFFAD5JQU_Q.text: Caravan Kings Cross has been an absolute delight each and every time I have been there. The drinks are well made, the staff snarky (in the best possible way), the room itself trendy, and the food exceptional. Fried duck eggs? Yes please!

C2WAV8PoT2nqOhOuOiu7DQ.text: Had a lovely meal on a Friday night. We had to wait a little for the table, but had a drink at the bar, so no biggy.The food was lovely - particular highlights were the chorizo & sweet potato croquettes, wasabi oysters, cornbread and the grits although it was all good. I'd recommend ordering in batches otherwise you can get carried away and end up with more food than you can handle!One note though - it's a nightmare to find. If you're walking from Kings Cross, take the second left after the canal (not the first as apple maps would suggest) and walk through the arts college to get there. It's worth the trek once you find it though! I'm very keen to try the other branch in angel and everything else from the menu

sroQJOdxUxvZuMtkWcZgnQ.text: Oh Caravan Kiwis, you've done it again!  Love ya.  I adore the Exmouth Market one and now I have a larger great new space (beautiful I must say) behind Kings X.  Walking through the fountains to my oasis of great wine, interesting small plates, fabulous cocktails, attentive service and yummy espresso martinis. The food is a 4 out of 5--but always interesting. The wine is always great and affordable, the coffee roasting is outstanding, but most importantly the vibe is what draws me in.  Good 30-something crowd, good music in the background, engaged staff.  This is the kind of place I would open......loving the new locale and the pizzas did look fab so a nice addition.  xoxo

xagzae82wYwicNmgl-rbiQ.text: Food is fine but trying to book is such a pain in the backside. You can't book brunch at all and it's too crowded to bring older people who can't wait a long time. So the only time I can take my family is dinner and then if you have a group of over 10 you need a set menu. The fact we're trying to accommodate multiple fussy eaters and a vegetarian doesn't matter, apparently. So it's impossible. And frankly the people I've dealt with there have all been rude. Go to Dishoom or Grain Store instead - both lovely.

hOPx-jqKXWOaML1GvErM6A.text: Had a wonderful lunch here, with everything from the service, quality of food and atmosphere absolutely spot on! Had massive food envy by opting for pizza as opposed to sampling the small plates on offer, but still, the pizza was still fantastic. Sampled some of the girlfriends deep fried duck egg with chorizo however, and oh my, I was lost in my food heaven. Both opted for an apple juice, and we were fairly sure the ingredients would have been hanging on the tree still this very morning. So fresh! Coffee to finish and all in all, a superb lunch spot. Easily take a client, date or your mother.Even at lunch time in this pretty quiet part of town, the place was buzzing and almost full. Highly recommend ringing ahead to book a table. If you're not sure, look for the water fountains in front of the restaurant, on the St Pancras side of The Filling Station! Also does take away!Will be back!

K2VqNATYZWjdX2O73NQD-Q.text: Definitely one of my favourite spots for a weekend brunch in London, especially in the winter. For the summer season, I think I'd still enjoy Caravan on Exmouth Market... which has some nice outdoor seating so one can soak in what little of the London summer sun one can get....But, I came to Caravan's Kings X in the winter, and I've made it a regular haunting ground, meeting with friends from the media and pr industry. It's a big place, much bigger than Exmouth Market, with tons of seating. The waiting area at the bar is great, and there is good wifi, and really good flat whites while you wait for a seat. Seating is very communal for the most part... a bit like the original 'Pain Quotidien'... and the warehouse feel is so urban derelict cool.I usually go for the bloody mary, which I enjoy, especially when I request and get it spicy... with a bit of kick. For breakfast, I'd recommend the baked eggs with chorizo sausage... a classic that can also be found in Exmouth, and is always a sure fire winner. Always fun to share this dish, and order a side of chili, avocado on sour dough bread.The brownie is to die for. If you want to die of a heart attack that is.All in all, cool place, gets pretty busy on the weekends, but i've never had to wait more than 15-20m. Well worth it.

XLcdVTuFhCQFaAjv6p5prw.text: Very good brunch. Great coffee (buy a pouch to go) and lively atmosphere. The surrounding campus area makes for an arty, scenic post-meal stroll.

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom

88ouBcFuMcNb1YdX1eVRwA.text: First timer - great breakfast , excellent service! Loved the place design! We went with our kids and they loved the food too. We all got the baked eggs with sausage and it was sublime!

NHrqWfQ7aWqiW8WwFSdOcw.text: I'm not prone to hyperbole but this place is the best brunch I've had in London. The kimchee pancake with duck egg was the perfect level of spicy and savoury. My partner had the baked eggs which arrived perfectly cooked on a bed of well sliced tomatoes. The bloody Mary's were also a treat. There is so many more things (pumpkin waffles, teriyaki crab omelette) to try that we'll be back soon!

BeOY76RGRWhfGJaI0XkISw.text: After a disappointing brunch experience, dinner made up for it! A friend & I shared some small plates and they kindly accommodated our request of a tasting of the risotto too. The cauliflower was the stand out dish. The pork belly was good because of the accompaniments but not crispy as described which is the most important thing about the dish. We agreed when seated that we would have to be finished within 45 minutes because of another booking which was absolutely fine except that it took a while for someone to take our order and then the manager was abrupt about us moving with 4 minutes to go. It worked out because we could sit in the shared space but I think he could have handled it with more finesse given we were paying customers and happy to accommodate. So not the best service but overall a great experience and a special mention for the Kiwi host who was an absolute sweetheart! Will definitely return.

c8X_xxyVVGY6dPJG3liDPw.text: Caravan's breakfasts are excellent, very tasty and beautiful. Good for lunch during the week too!I often go there with friends and we always have a good time.Bonus: I work right next to it!

EnybJp91dFTkQleh1Z01nw.text: Awesome spot to come for brunch with friends. Great individual original dishes and the coffee is great too! Would love to come back for a lunch and dinner. Definitely suggest booking a reservation first because it gets pretty full quickly.

IRfMOJyvYZIl4P4Gu_peUw.text: Great food, lovely atmosphere. Unfortunately though they served food on cold plates so my food was only just warm enough. As it was I was in a hurry so it wasn't an issue, but if I was with someone and eating socially then this would've been an issue. The same happened with the coffee - half cold.

aOlKGjF61wqx3B7eNcO3MA.text: As a big fan of the Exmouth Market original I was slightly taken aback at the sheer size of Caravan's King's Cross iteration. It was certainly popular enough to justify the size; only 45 minutes after opening it was already fairly crowded with a bunch of brunch hungry patrons. Scaling a restaurant up to fill a bigger venue must be a difficult job and it is impressive that the original venture's charm is carried into this new iteration. Much of this is to do with the staff who are just as friendly and engaging as ever. It also helps that the coffee (made with in house roasted beans) is also still great. What hasn't worked so well is the food. In particular, the smoked haddock rarebit was very disappointing, the rarebit element completely lacking in punch and flavour. My Parmesan grits and boar sausage was better although once the sausage had been devoured the dish lost balance and texture. It needed either more sausage or less grits.These are relatively minor gripes and I hope they are remedied because the King's Cross area is still relatively short of good restaurant options for the hungry traveller.

ZyRwQFnZGQnXyxkT3Af1tQ.text: Well that was a really awesome lunch, complete with coffee flavoured beer! We went for plates to share which is a great way to do it - the chilli chicken with watermelon was amazing as was the Stilton with pine nuts, figs and truffle oil :)

photos.caption: Photo of Caravan Kings Cross - London, United Kingdom. A selection of rather awesome sharing dishes!

IQdud52_bC2R2Biv9qliLg.text: Decent food but questionable service. We booked a table at 6:00 and were told we had to vacate it at 8:00, even though we hadn't even finished our meal yet! They actually put our cheque down on the table and told us the next group had arrived and it was time to leave.

2Codbzj7IunFx_HKVsA2pw.text: Fantastic small plates menu with some real tasty gems - crab & sweet potato, tofu, swan smoked salmon being stand out choices. Desert menu equally imaginative- pumpkin cheese cake, pomegranate panacota and rhubarb and apple granola bake. Service was excellent and the restaurant had a warm, weekend, feel good ambience about it.

rQCwVVAToghtJlv_k_Smjg.text: Great atmosphere, good coffee, reasonably priced & very nice furnishings. I'm a big fan of the aesthetics here overall.

XKLBwCa4ljW4dyA9ZqjaKw.text: Yummy food! Will stop here again when I go back to London. Very fun atmosphere. The food comes in small portions but it's very tasty!

xbxPVN7ZJ_W6sk9Y6vEX5g.text: Not the place for a quiet romantic dinner! Not on a Thursday night anyway! Converted warehouse just behind King's Cross, lovely fountains outside set the scene. Had table booked for 8.45pm arrived a bit early but despite being full go seated bang on time. Varied menu we decided to go for small plates to share. Tapas to you and I! Good but unusual choices to suit all tastes. Service good worth a visit.

Q70drPTXv8MKlQzHo-bI1Q.text: I finally got around to trying the King's Cross branch of Caravan over the weekend. As much as I love the other Caravan, I was curious about this one because a) it's bigger and b) it's quite easy to get to for me from the train station.So a few of us ventured here. And even though it's bigger, we were still told there was going to be a 40 minute wait. Luckily, that was only 20 minutes and we sat down to eat. We were sat at a communal table, so be aware that while there are quite a few tables for two or four, there are larger communal tables that you may end up at.Drinks-wise I had filter coffee, which as the other location they do as well. We also had quite a few of the smoke tomato and beef bloody Marys. They are very spicy and quite tasty, but not the best I've had in London. There was a bit of something missing, not sure what, but I'd definitely have more of them.For mains I had the jalapeno cornbread with eggs. Other dishes at the table were the Raclette French Toast, the full English and a crab omelette. I think mine was the least interesting. The cornbread was kind of bland and the texture was just wrong. We did order a side of chorizo which went okay with it. The crab omelette though was a triumph. I took one bite of it and knew I made a mistake with my order. The raclette french toast was also pretty amazing, but a lot richer and heavier than the omelette. I also tried the pumpkin, goat cheese and pine nut muffin which was tasty. We tried a peanut butter cookie, but I can make and have several better recipes.So all in all, I had a good time. Is it better than the original? Unfortunately not. The food is different, and maybe not quite as good. The venue is big and really loud and lost quite a bit of intimacy the original venue has. It doesn't mean I won't go back to this one, as the location is much easier, but the Exmouth branch really has the slight edge for me.

xrGfY4OUBhHNJ4V4jz8_MA.text: I have been to this restaurant twice over the past two years.  It has a sophisticated eclectic dishes that just work. The decor is modern cool and the atmosphere is fun, although a couple of years on, the style is not as bang on trend as it was. Seeing the kitchen from the restaurant is great there is a real creative feel about what they do. Average age is early thirties, people in their early twenties did not seem to get as much out of it, some people were in their fifties but they were a minority. The service was good, but when on a table there was the feeling of getting an allocated waiter or waitress for that set of tables.  Other servers did not really want to do tables outside their area.  Most of the staff are warm,  hospitable and friendly, but sadly a quarter are a bit standofishAlso the second time we came,  we did have to wait about 20 minutes for the table after the time it had been pretty booked for. We just did not feel so cared about during this time. The dishes were good and to have lots of small tapas sized portions, but for more general eclectic dishes I found really cool.  Very good dishes, a cool place.  A good place to take people to and they will not be disappointed.

-UcnllN4grH3On1tcXhrlw.text: A great resource by King's Cross. You simply walk over the bridge and end up at the warehouse (several restaurants and University of Arts London has taken over). You can sit inside or out. My party of five elected to sit indoors and we spent a few minutes remarking on how slick the lightbulbs and tables looked. A bit pricey but everyone was pleased with what they ordered. The only issue we had was with the size and cost of the drinks. Otherwise no complaints.

cX1iN722BCsfIrx1kFwqcQ.text: Being a lover of the original Caravan in Exmouth Market, I really wanted to love this larger location nearer to where I live in King's Cross.But I didn't. It was far too busy. People were waiting for upwards to an hour and a half for tables on my Sunday morning visit. I opted for immediate seating at the bar - and then spent the next hour and a half either trying desperately to catch the attention of the disinterested bar staff or eating awkwardly with my legs askew to the not-at-all-accommodating bar whilst what seemed like five million yuppie parents wheeled their prams awfully close to my feet which I was forced to dangle precariously in the cramped walkway to the communal toilets.Worse still, the coffee was average, the food was just OK, and I didn't even finish my bloody mary. Which is shameful.And no thanks to the communal toilet. I'm a progressive, feminist woman and all, but I don't even like ladies hearing my bathroom business at the best of times. I prefer not to add an entirely new facet to public loo self-consciousness.

o8ZxiKaJp_VwBjjiajTI1w.text: Nice place and busy place. Better to eat outside with the sun, price is ok

VnRAU3i-nqY0xwGwhzT-sg.text: I want to like Caravan, I really do. I want to give it more stars purely for the food, but I just can't. The reason why I can't give it more stars is because of the service. I always enjoy the food when I go, today was no exception, however, I think after this visit, I won't be in a hurry to go back. There is something about Caravan that oozes "Too cool for school". When my friend and I walked in today for lunch, we waited to be seated. Fair enough. What wasn't fair enough was that we weren't even acknowledged. Admittedly the Maître D was with someone else, but there was no nod or any indication that he would be with us shortly, even when I directly made eye contact. When he finished with the person he was serving, he didn't address us immediately, he just let us loiter in the doorway, awkwardly waiting for a table before casually asking what we wanted. Once seated, we were attended to well enough, our server took our order, no problems. Our small dishes started arriving and they were perfect. My favourite was the ash goats cheese and the inari tofu. Delicious. However, as we were eating our meal, the same dishes that we clearly already had on our table arrived again. This is the second time this has happened to me at Caravan. We finished our meal without incident, as I said, it was delicious and we ordered two coffees to go as we wanted to walk along the canals. While we waited for our coffees, the check also came out. When our coffees arrived, we had the money and a card ready to pay. We waited, we waited, still no one came. This was until we flagged someone down who said they would get someone to deal with it. All of this would have been fine, but what really made the experience less than impressive was that as I was waiting for my friend to return from the bathroom so we could leave, a waitress came up to me and told me that they would need the table back. I looked at her incredulously as clearly we had paid, we had takeaway coffees because we wanted to go and I was obviously waiting for my friend who was in the bathroom. If they had told me before we sat down they needed the table back at a specific time, no problems, but there was no conditions to us being seated. Furthermore, if they had wanted us to leave, they should have taken the money we had sitting on the table for 15 minutes so that we could actually leave. The waitress quickly tried to backtrack and said that they would need it in 5 minutes, but either way, no one appreciates being rushed out of a restaurant. I understand that you want to do more covers, but seriously, that is just downright rude. The only reason Caravan gets 3 stars is the food. I want to give it 2 stars, but the food is just too good.

uOaA6x03oviDQ6AnwDTbQQ.text: Very good but quite expensive for the quantity. Be careful the bread is a little too much overcooked.

FZ43SmXezp7Xl3Y0nQY3qQ.text: Very happy with both options we ordered. The sweet potato and cumin waffle was such a random but amazing combination of flavors. Also the barbecue beans with chorizo is a must. Will definitely be going back here.

PKsgO07UcLLBSl93ENcC2w.text: Choosing eateries entirely on the strength of their coffee reviews seems dangerous. In really, the only danger here is to the waistline. Sublime food, the plate of many vegetables had everyone coming back for more, the potato bread was sweet and tender, and the coffee sublime

AdHtUuX73MjITXiTktq6HQ.text: Wow.  The location of this place both excites me and pains my heart. Its right next to The famous Drama Centre. Anyway...this square looks stunning at night! Our waiter was one of the friendliest I've ever had! Goats Cheese salad is like my thing and this one didn't disappoint. The salted caramel truffel was so good I can't even use words amazing enough to describe it. WOW.

xQ8ta21oQ_eETrW1ZJ66PQ.text: Good brunch food and cocktails when we went on a Sunday morning. A good variety of the typical London brunch options. Line wasn't too bad and we were able to snag a table outside and enjoy the nice weather.

nGcJmEnkkU6gb8Rq1XL1Kg.text: Who doesn't love a converted warehouse with communal tables?Caravan has a melting pot of a menu with inspirations from Morocco, Egypt and yes, even London. The bread with olive oil and dukkah (£3) is simple but flavorful, and goes down well with a local IPA from Camden. (a pricey £5.50)If you only look at nearby tables, you'd think they only serve pizzas. But the orange teriyaki udon noodles with bok choy and mushrooms (£13.50) while small, was one hell of a delicious dish.Funnily enough, I managed to remember all the prices but forgot to take any photos!Oh, and they make a fairly awesome flat white. (£2.40)

hnEAUob5XEvnAuT7Ch_6YA.text: I have never been this badly treated from the minute I walked into a restaurant. Went to Caravan today at 1.30 pm after hearing good things from a few friends and seeing great ratings on Yelp. The restaurant has a weird system of giving you a pack of coffee beans with a number on it, and then coming to find you when your number comes up in their system. That's fine, but it becomes pretty easy to say "we tried to find you, but couldn't." Anyway, we were told it would be a 40-50 min wait despite seeing several free tables when we walked in. We waited at the bar with our numbered bag of coffee beans clearly in sight. After 40 mins, I went back to the two hostesses (who, may I add were EXTREMELY RUDE and snooty) and they said it had "only been 39 minutes" and we would need to wait "another 20 mins at least." I told her that the table for 3 that had been empty 40 mins ago was still empty (as were plenty of other tables), but for some reason she said she couldn't seat us as there were others in line (????). I told her we didn't want to wait anymore and left. She chased us out of the restaurant and very rudely said, "you need to close out your tab at the bar." I told her we'd already done it. She said it wasn't in the system and she would need to see a receipt. All of this was done loudly (and rudely) in front of the diners sitting outside. We showed her the receipt and she briskly said thanks and quickly went inside. No apologies offered at all. In short, I don't care whether their omelette tastes like heaven in my mouth, I'm never going back to this place or recommending it to anyone else. Save your time and dignity and go to any of the hundreds of other great brunch spots in London.

pG2oJg7yeWbJTGq2m_G5qA.text: There's this thing that's taken over the London food scene: Small plates to be shared over (usually good) alcohol. Caravan sits in that category comfortably.Turned up on a Saturday night with four friends without a reservation. We were advised we'd have to wait for 45 minutes but by the time we sat at the bar our table was ready. That was efficient.So we managed to sat down and got ourselves some drinks. They made my Gibson martini properly and I was surprised it was so good and with a normal price tag. I've tried another cocktail - something Earl Gray that was delicious.Food-wise it got a bit complicated. We went for a range of small dishes and then finished it off with a main each. I must admit though that their small dishes are smaller than expected! Their asparagus with some red sauce seemed nice, albeit a bit charred. Also - 3 asparagus was not a satisfactory quantity.The scallop carpaccio with bean sprouts was impressive though it was hard to stomach the use of popcorn in such a dish. It seemed as it was intentionally put there to make the dish seem fusion. Their fried chicken came in the form of 3 croquettes that tasted pretty good (how can fried chicken go wrong?).The small plate highlight was the stuffed courgette flower with chipotle ricotta. It was brilliant in every sense, heavy and bold. We've also tried fried cauliflower balls (nothing special), prawns over some red sauce and a couple other plates that I forgot about. Again, these were good but they were really small on the quanity. Our waiter advised us that one would need 2-3 small plates or a large one to eat enough. Had I listened to him, I could see myself eating a dodgy kebab on the way home.The large plates were pretty much satisfactory, quantity-wise and with good prices. I ordered the welsh lamb that had ran out by then so switched it to a pork chop. The pork chop was very well cooked, however I found the addition of cooked apricots a bit unappetising. My friend's pollock dish smelt very good and it seemed like it was a well made dish.Their serving time was adequate, however this was dealt with as they cook the food fresh and as you order.It's a nice place. I might return but under different circumstances. I can see it as a bit of a romanticky date kind of place. Bit loud but with well thought of and polished edges.

i0dajyrGYoglc6NDjRreMQ.text: I can't yet comment on the food. Whenever I'm in the area, I always tend to grab delicious street food from Kerb, just opposite. The coffee, however, is the best I've had in London. The espresso-based drinks are all absolutely delicious and they do a cracking flat white. The filter coffee is fine, about as good as filter coffee can be, which is never as good as an Americano of course... The atmosphere is great and staff friendly, cheerful and helpful.

RvWjxCXbF6_Y5i5E6CrRnw.text: So my favourite brunch/coffee spot just opens an even bigger place in the impressive new amalgamated University of the Arts campus, KingsX. Don't get me wrong the Exmouth market shop is still totally awesome and different enough to keep me returning, but I can't say I haven't been pondering the possibilities of post-graduate study just to rock up to school and hang out at Caravan Kings Cross all day... (and eat the jalapeño corn bread smothered in spring onions, coriander and aioli butter).Amazing coffee.Superb menu.Enormous space.Friendly staff.Cool location.This place is PACKED out on the weekend, and the people know what is good brunch. Queues don't lie...

rUkU-NYwaJu2Un3ufMR2nw.text: Came to Caravan after work one evening, hidden behind Kings Cross station the place itself seems unfinished adopting a chic warehouse style food hall.  Its in an old granary store afterall so retains part of that feel.  The whole area is being regenerated and Kings Cross as a whole will be awash soon with bars and places to eat. This place will be at the heart.The menu a variety of pizzas and sharing style foods looked interesting.  I went simple with a chorizo and goats cheese pizza. Yum. And can say great service (thanks Chloe), who made us very welcome with attentive service, the pizza wasn't half bad either.This appears more of a breakfast/brunch place so will be back to try. Also can definitely recommend for an evening bite or meeting place on way home from work.

fbuJKwWOSeWB2zLvVcIbeA.text: We came here for a brunch catch up with some friends that we hadn't seen for a while.  It is a busy place, but not too noisy.  There is an attractive selection of brunch options and a good drinks menu.  At the busiest times, though, you need to be prepared to wait for a table.We had a round of drinks while we were perusing the menu.  My wife had a coffee which she enjoyed, and I had a banana smoothie (more because it was such a hot day!)Two of us ordered french toast, another had the cured salmon and I had the baked eggs chorizo.  Three of our dishes arrived in a reasonable time, but the 4th was missing.  After waiting for a while and wondering what the story was, we let the waitress know and she checked with the kitchen.  I think they had just forgotten it.  Of course, no-one was starting their meal until everyone had their's, so we were all getting a bit hungry.  When the cured salmon dish finally arrived, it was the least-impressive looking of the lot.I was happy with my meal: the tomatoes went well with the chorizo and I mopped up the sauce with the toast.  I got to have a slice of the french toast and I enjoyed that too.My 3-star rating is driven by the long delay in getting our last meal.  If it were based on the quality of the food and drinks, then I may have been pushed to give 4 stars.

UTQyBET7K1yTyKALnamDgQ.text: Caravan is the new it place in London and it is hard to get a table there on a weekend However, I was lucky to find a table last Sunday and during this week And enjoyed my brunch very much However, coffee is not that special ! Definitely a place to visit - food is sensational
